item.title: On the Fly Garbage Collection an Exercise in Cooperation (1978)
item.description: In Go 1.5, the algorithm of the garbage collector (GC) changed to a concurrent, tri-color, mark-sweep collector, which was first proposed by Dijkstra et al. in 1978. The algorithm proposed by Dijkstra et al. alternates a marking phase and an appending phase. In the marking phase, the garbage collector colors reachable objects in gray or black. In the appending phase, it collects white objects that are unreachable from things on the stack and global variables. The algorithm prioritizes minimizing the atomic operations of the garbage collector to reduce overhead on the application.
